contentrichtext.text: {{Use mdy dates|date=November 2011}} '''Visvaldas Marijus Mažonas''' (born August 25, 1941 in [[Šiauliai]]) is a controversial figure of radical right-wing political movement in [[Lithuania]]. He was a leader of a branch of the [[Lithuanian Patriotic Union]] ''(Lietuvos patriotų sąjunga)'' in [[Kaunas]] and participated in the 2004 election to the [[Seimas]] (Lithuanian Parliament).<ref name=kand/> Before plunging into politics, Mažonas held various jobs as a policemen, driver, security guard, construction worker.<ref name=kand/> He entered the political scene after the [[impeachment]] of [[Rolandas Paksas]], former [[President of Lithuania]]. During the impeachment, Mažonas supported Paksas, attended various protest meetings, and vouched to "maintain order".<ref>[http://www.delfi.lt/archive/article.php?id=3565972 Ultraradikalas žada ir toliau ginti prezidentą]. Delfi.lt. Retrieved on November 23, 2011.</ref> During one incident, when he attempted to "keep order", Mažonas hit a high school student, who opposed Paksas. The event attracted media attention and Mažonas faced criminal charges (eventually reduced to [[misdemeanor]]).<ref>[http://www.sekunde.lt/content.php?p=read&tid=16333 V. Mažonas pripažintas tik nusižengusiu, bet ne nusikaltusiu]. Sekunde.lt. Retrieved on November 23, 2011.</ref> Paksas did not immediately distance himself from Mažonas.<ref>[http://www.delfi.lt/archive/article.php?id=3563094 R.Paksas nesiryžta aiškiai atsisakyti radikalų paramos]. Delfi.lt. Retrieved on November 23, 2011.</ref> Mažonas is known for disorderly conduct, provocations, insulting speeches,<ref>[http://www.lrytas.lt/-12221094401220120915-dulkiant-lietui-kaune-tul%C5%BE%C4%AF-liejo-nacionalistai-video.htm Dulkiant lietui Kaune tulžį liejo nacionalistai]. Lrytas.lt (September 22, 2008). Retrieved on November 23, 2011.</ref> threats to overthrow the government,<ref>[http://www.lrytas.lt/?id=11826071821182325655&view=4 Laisvės alėjoje tulžį liejo M.Murzos šalininkai]. Lrytas.lt (June 23, 2007). Retrieved on November 23, 2011.</ref> displaying stylized Nazi [[swastika]]s.<ref>[http://www.delfi.lt/archive/article.php?id=21926485 Gegužės 1-ąją Šiauliuose plevėsavo vėliavos su nacių simbolika]. Delfi.lt. Retrieved on November 23, 2011.</ref> He and his supporters often wear black uniforms.<ref>[http://www.delfi.lt/archive/article.php?id=17927048 Tremtinių sąskrydyje – incidentas dėl ultraradikalų]. Delfi.lt. Retrieved on November 23, 2011.</ref><ref>[http://www.delfi.lt/archive/article.php?id=13136214 „Murzininkai“ rikiavosi prie Estijos ambasados]. Delfi.lt. Retrieved on November 23, 2011.</ref> During the trial of the suspected Holocaust perpetrator [[Algimantas Dailidė]], Mažonas held signs supporting Dailidė.<ref>[http://www.delfi.lt/archive/article.php?id=9141106 Už nusikaltimus žydams nuteistą A.M.Dailidę nuo kalėjimo išgelbėjo senatvė]. Delfi.lt. Retrieved on November 23, 2011.</ref> In another incident, he protested a monument to [[Danielius Dolskis]], a [[Lithuanian Jew]].<ref>[http://www.litjews.org/Default.aspx?Element=ViewArticle&ArticleID=1585&TopicID=12&Lang=EN Danielius Dolskis Has Returned to Kaunas]{{dead link|date=November 2011}}</ref> Mažonas often collaborates with another extremist [[Mindaugas Murza]].<ref>[http://www.delfi.lt/archive/article.php?id=20224663 Kauno mitingas: apie 400 žmonių, 2 sulaikyti]. Delfi.lt. Retrieved on November 23, 2011.</ref> ==References== {{reflist|2|refs= <ref name=kand>[http://www3.lrs.lt/rinkimai/2004/seimas/kandidatai/kand_biog_l_294419.htm Visvaldas Marijus MAŽONAS. Kandidato biografija]. .lrs.lt.
